text: Our teens are off to a volunteer meeting for the Denver MS walk on May 5th.
College tour day!  Air force academy
We are looking for volunteer opportunities for out teens in the culinary industry, have any leads?
Doing some major planning for the next three months.
Working on baked goods this week.  Our new volunteer site is all about baking for the elderly.
Ronald McDonald house was a success!  Can't wait to get the kids back there!
Taking our teen group to cook at Ronald McDonald House tomorrow.
Thinking about our next set of classes, Asian is on the spectrum.
Exactly how much does an outfitted food truck cost?
Food Bank of the Rockies will have a load of teen volunteers heading there way Saturday.
Taking our kids to the cook at the Ronald McDonald house next month.
@FoodRev sent two emails but always get a general reply.

Put out our first newsletter yesterday,  Feeling good about it!
http://t.co/lY4PuwJF
Just wrapped up our first fundraiser, Spoon by the Pint! Had a blast and met some new people.  Plus, Dry Dock Brewing Company was the great.

It's harder than I thought, getting support from other nonprofits.  Back to the drawing board.

Offering Indian food to my niece for the second time today.  I'd say it went well!

Went to a petting zoo today.  Couldn't help but stare at the pigs.  So tasty!

RT @WholeFoods: Each RT of this = $1 to the Xerces Society to help the declining honey bee population. PLEASE RT and help us give $10K!  ...
spent the whole day tracking down prizes for an upcoming fundraiser.  Exhausted!
@MarcusCooks  Thank you for signing the chef hats for our fundraiser!  Hope you enjoyed Denver!
@marcuscooks just missed you at Whole Foods! Will you be signing in Boulder? Gotta meet you!
Chasing down Marcus Samuelsson for an autograph!  Just missed him in Denver, off to Boulder!!
@Chefjefflive thank you for responding to our Tweet!  Are you ever in Denver, our kids would love to meet you!
@Chefjefflive  Hi Chef Jeff! We are a cooking program for children based in Denver, inspired by your reality show!  Wanted to say thank you!
@SavorySpiceShop meat tenderizer? http://t.co/j0zQZuxv
@sarahanncurl just sent the e-mail over to the address that you sent us.  Thanks for taking a look at the information.
@CookingMatters our program could really use a mentor program, can Cooking Matters help us?
@FoodRev Denver based kids cooking program needs a mentor, can you help us?
@FoodRevBigRig Teaching cooking skills to kids here in Denver.  We travel to schools and community centers, we need a mentor program, help!
Fundraising with beer and bbq, not a bad idea at all!
Found a peach tree growing on the side of the road yesterday, its gonna make a great cobbler today.
Need fundraising ideas for the up comming school year
Does anyone have a working 15 passenger van they'd like to donate to The Spoon?  We need it to take our participants on field trips!
Denver seems so far away, but happy to eat my Detroit favorites!!  Hello Olga's!
Let's get this van back home!  Denver we're on our way! http://t.co/rOhtys22
Still in Detroit.  Ready to go back to Denver and teach some cooking classes.
Does anyone really read other peoples Tweets?!
Still waiting for the head gasket to be fixed on the van.  Bored.
So the van that was donated to us for field trips needs head gasket work!  Now what?
@MomsRising We have a nonprofit cooking program for children in Denver, can we collaborate?
@TylerFlorence Makes sense to me.
@FarmtoSchool.  Have a nonprofit cooking program for children in Denver, with a garden.  Ideas?
@MVoltaggio Aint that the truth!
@Brewbound Thinking about doing a beer tasting fundraiser in Denver for our childrens cooking program,  any ideas?
@nokidhungry Started a childrens cooking program in Denver area, how can we help?
@tina24hour just rain boots!
Got a van donated to The Spoon!  We can finally take kids on field trips without having to rent a van!
Time to start getting the community garden together!  Dirt, dirt and more dirt!
On a. Fi.
@FoodRevBigRig love what you are doing in LA, trying to do the same in denver. Any advice on where to find grant support?
Big field trip tomorrow to a food distributor.  Kids are excited!
Had a great class yesterday!  Made authentic Mexican with a great group of kids!
The Spoon « CBS Denver http://t.co/Hn1VRZi5
First Youtube video will be launched today!  The kids can cook!
Field trip ideas related to food for 10 year olds...any suggestions?
Youtube videos featuring our cooking class students...hilarious.
Fieldtrip to Johnson and Wales University was great for our teen group, got them thinking about college...the whole point!
Fieldtrip to Thai food restaurant with our elementary school group!
Catering, catering and more catering!
Kickstarter baby!
The Spoon will be working with a new school in Feb.,  Sagebrush Elementary!
Catering last night went great!  The more gigs we have the more classes we can teach our kids!
A new school may be joining together with The Spoon!  We need your support now than ever!
Cooking Club is back in action!  The break was well needed, now let's get cooking!
Help your family recipes live on, share them with us: bradfordcl2@yahoo.com.  When we make them with the kids we'll send you pictures!
Cooking with the kids at Arapahoe green community center. We are baking apple cinnamon muffins today, A great  way to apples.
I Gotta a surplus of acorn squash, So what do i do? Acorn squash pie just as good as pumpkin maybe better. Just google a recipe.
Spent to whole night coming up with next week menus!
We have our first private cooking class on Saturday!  It's a group of Daisy Scouts earning their cooking badge.  This should be interesting!
The Spoon is looking for ways to expand.  Any ideas?
The school year started with a bang!  We have two sites for our program!  Plus, with our Pepsi Refresh funds we have new equipment!
I'm attending CNE: Developing your Message & Effective Grant Writing http://t.co/VP73tLO #constantcontact
The time has come for school to start!  That means more classes and fun!  Hope to see you there!
The Spoon is ready for more classes!  Tomorrow, we're making refrigerator pickles with our k-5 summer camp group!
Why is it so hard to write grants?

The Spoon will be on channel 4 at 7:45 am on Sunday here in Denver.
How do I get my nonprofit in the news for the great things we are doing?
@jamieoliver Stirring it is the easy part, making sure the bottom doesn't get burned is harder.
Quick update, the school garden is doing great, ready for new cooking classes, have to learn grant writing, still love chocolate.
Having an awesome day, we got our first grant!
@ForestOakGrant its still early here!  I will vote for you guys!!!
Vote to give this idea 10K: Start a Youth Cooking Program in Denver area schools!   #pepsirefresh @Pepsi http://t.co/hzolp7D
Summer vacation is around the corner and we need to teach more classes to raise money for our free programs.
@npsl community gardens bringing people and ideas together
@jayncc1701 that's how I feel about Denver.
@carybrothers @rvrb  Jealous!
@davidlebovitz  Take us with you!  We promise, we'll be good!
The school garden finally got planted yesterday.  Today it's pretty chilly, I hope the veggies hold up!
We're excited for the fieldtrip to Delaney Farm next Thursday!  The kids will get a chance to see a community farm and get overly filthy!
We are supposed to be putting in the garden on Friday with the cooking club kids, but it's snowing right now!!  Hope it clears up soon!
@roccodispirito  Lots of greens: kale, collards, watercress etc.

The garden is  on it's way!  We put in two yards of soil!  Hopefully, we can get the veggies in the ground soon.

So, we're in the running for a grant from Pepsi.  We're super excited about it!

The kids made Thai Curry Chicken in coconut milk today.  I was impressed!
Your Billboard > Because Kids Love To Cook Too! | Values - Pass It On http://t.co/PMBnO4k   This is the billboard I made for my husband!
@WholeFoods Just started a school garden with some kids in our cooking club, for sure we will keep this going all year.
We finally pulled weeds and grass to clean up the garden and get it ready for planting.  It took 3 adults and 9 kids 3 hours.  Can't Wait!
It's been raining like crazy here in dusty CO, all this moisture is good for the school's garden!
@happyhourmary Amen.
Going to price materials for our school garden tomorrow.  I hoping that we can get donations for the fencing!  Cross your fingers!
Just surveyed the garden we're bringing back to life...it's looking like we have our hands full!
Just pressed "submit" on our first grant application!  It only took 90 work hours and a lot of confusion.  I'll keep you all updated.
@happyhourmary true I find the same true for teachers.
Another succesful cooking class.  Chicken noodle soup.  I have to admit this group has to be our easiest!  I'm looking forward to next week!
I guess we're having the kids make the classic chicken noodle soup this week in cooking class.
Had the grand idea of starting a school garden at the location of our cooking class.  They have the dirt and the kids, we've got the seeds.
Working on hour 75 of writing a grant.  I have to admit that I'm enjoying the experience.  You learn something new when you stretch yourself
Finished our first teen class!  It went great, they really got into it.  If we can teach teens than we can do anything!
Wednesday will be our first class working with teens, I'm a little nervous, but I'm sure it will be fine.  We'll be making pickles with them
Second session of Cooking Club started today.  Oatmeal applesauce muffins, fiber hiding in every cranny.  The kids never saw it coming.
Looks like this summer won't involve vacation for me.  The Spoon will be working out in Bennet at their rec center teaching classes!
Here we go again, the second session of Cooking Club starts on Friday.  This group of kids has more drama queens than the last group.
Just finished the last cooking class with our first group of kids!  I'm gonna miss those brats!
@chezpim Couldn't hurt to try, right!
@NidaRahm My kids cooking club will be "tasting" hummus tomorrow.  I'm sure many of them have never had it before.
@PippajaneLoo Come to Colorado!!  The sun is always shinin!
@winecopywriter I saw a few buds on trees when I went for a walk Monday.  Spring might be close for Denver, CO.
Would you like to help us reach and teach more kids with our free cooking classes? Please donate on our site.  www.thecommunityspoon.org
Friday is the last day for this cooking class, Cliff decided on having them make salsa and pico.  I'm going to miss this first class!
Hey everybody, we finally have a website!  Check us out www.thecommunityspoon.org
Just left cooking club the kids voted on pancakes.  I think its cause they like flipping them.
The one thing that I am figuring out is that you don't know you need something until someone asks for it.
Up late, eyes burning, must send e-mails.
We got our 501 (c)3 paperwork back today!  We couldn't believe it only took 6 weeks.  Nothing but a miracle from God!
Quickbooks....not that quick.
Just left a meeting at the American Legion.  They want to have a children's cooking event at their hall!  Looking forward to it.
Going to H-Mart (Asian Store) for supplies for the Girl Scout's cooking class.  Always new sights and smells.
@coloradoculture Thanks, everyone should at least know how to boil water!
Have I mention how much I love grant writing? (Sarcasm)
@happyhourmary Please don't say that.  I loved Star Trek.  I'm not old...am I?
Thai apple salad, fantastic.  Granny Smith had no idea what she missed out on.
Parent magazine did an article about cooking with kids this month.  Check it out!
Ate in the lunchroom with some girls from Cooking Club today, I'm so proud they knew all the food groups on their plates!
Grant writing.............
Kinda got excited today cause we got another donation!  For all that are reading this, you may have no idea how donations help nonprofits!
Had my students vote on what they wanted to cook in Cooking Club next week, their choice...pancakes.  Gotta love simplicity.
@denverfoodnews Hope this isn't true, if so we've spent tons of money on a fading logo.
We're looking forward to teaching a class to our first Girl Scout Troop!  They picked spring rolls with peanut sauce to make.  Sounds good!
The kids had ostrich yesterday in cooking club!  I made sure they ate their sample before I told them what it was. Where was my camera?

Tomorrow's "taste of the day"  is...well a bird that human being can race on.
Let's see if the kids will like this.
It's almost time for the school's girl scout troop to get their cooking badge!
The kids made pasta salad in Cooking Club last week.  I thought it was going to be easy until the boys started slinging vinegar and oil.
I'm looking for a grant writer for The Spoon.  Who knew the process of finding someone would be so....
I'm thinking of making salad dressing with the Cooking Club this week.  I'm sure it will be a shock to their parents that they ask for salad
Seeing how my organization just joined Twitter this week I have no clue how to use this thing, but I'm gonna keep on trying!
Yfrog Photo : yfrog.com/hs6incbj - Shared by cheffalkner http://t.co/aopk8Jd via @yfrog beautiful
@fandw I made freezer jam with a group of kids for their parents with as Valentine's Day gift.  They loved decorating the jars.
Everything turned out great tdoay.  Only six kids showed up at Cooking Club this week, that meant plenty of extra freezer jam for everyone!
Just finished buying 30 pounds of strawberries and 25 pounds of sugar for the freezer jam.  The kids better love it!
@eartheats I just tried Red Bean flavored ice cream.  I  picked it up at an Asian Super Market.
This week in Cooking Club, a cooking class for 5th graders, we're making freezer jam!  I'm excited because we've never done this recipe.
So excited!  We got our first donation today!
Hey everyone!  The Spoon is a nonprofit that teaches cooking skills to youth and adults.  We're new and excited to get to work in Colorado!
